module.title: fad
module.meta: length, long, while, for, all, whole, duration
module.p: fad length is an abstract (masculine) noun, derived from the adjective fada long.
Forms of fad are also used to introduce a temporal adverbial phrase or clause, as if it were a preposition or conjunction.
The main uses of fad are –

ol.li: As an abstract noun meaning length, the quality of being long

As a reduced compound preposition (reduced from older air fad or am fad), governing a noun phrase describing a temporal interval, and introducing a adverbial phrase of temporal extent (how long?) –
indefinite – bha sinn pòsta fad bliadhna we were married for a year
definite – bha sinn còmhla ri chèile fad na bliadhna we were together all year (long)

In the compound subordinate conjunction fhad ’s a ..., governing an imperfective clause, and introducing an adverbial clause of temporal extent or location –
modifying an imperfective – as long as, (all the) while, e.g. fhad ’s a bha mi thall thairis, bha i ag obair all the while I was abroad, she was working
modifying a perfective – while, e.g. fhad ’s a bha mi thall thairis, phòs i while I was abroad, she got married

box.title: fad as a preposition of temporal extent – indefinite uses
box.p: fad can be used as (reduced compound) preposition introducing an adverbial phrase of temporal extent, describing the duration of a state or activity. When fad governs an indefinite temporal interval noun, it means something like English for.
See the corresponding durative use of airson for.

box.title: fad as a preposition of temporal extent – definite uses
box.p: When the temporal extent preposition fad governs a definite temporal interval noun, it corresponds to English all ... (long), the whole, throughout.

box.title: fhad ’s a as a conjunction of temporal extent
box.p: fad can be used as a kind of subordinating conjunction, introducing an imperfective temporal adverbial clause describing the time period over which some other situation extends, or within which an action happens. In this sense, fad is usually lenited and conjoined using a contracted version of agus and with a relative clause, i.e. fhad ’s a (tha).

box.title: fhad’s a as a conjunction of temporal location
